meanings.definition: The state or quality of being boggy.
meanings.sent1: The bogginess of the marsh made it difficult to walk through.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the bogginess of the ground made it squishy underfoot.
meanings.sent3: The bogginess of the field turned a simple walk into a messy adventure.
meanings.sent4: The bogginess of the swamp seemed to swallow everything that ventured too close.
meanings.sent5: The bogginess of the soil felt like stepping on a sponge filled with water.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being soft, wet, and muddy.
meanings.sent1: The bogginess of the path made it slippery after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The bogginess of the garden soil was perfect for planting water-loving plants.
meanings.sent3: The bogginess of the playground turned a game of tag into a messy affair.
meanings.sent4: The bogginess of the riverbank threatened to suck in anything that got too close.
meanings.sent5: The bogginess of the clay made it impossible to keep your shoes clean.
